Purpose: To provide a parliamentary platform to identify and debate global health issues and concerns, raise the profile of global health within Parliament and government and prepare reports and make recommendations as appropriate.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Security and Non-Proliferation

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Golf
Purpose: To support the sport of golf.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Governance and Inclusive Leadership
Purpose: To raise the issue of inclusive leadership and governance in all areas of society with the aim of making it the norm for people from visible minorities to be in positions of power and influence throughout the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Greater Manchester
Purpose: To bring MPs and Peers of all parties together with key leaders - including the mayor and those in local government, the private sector and social enterprise - to help maximise future investment in the region for the benefit of all its local communities.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Greyhound Group
Purpose: To raise parliamentary awareness of issues relating to the greyhound industry. To promote the sport and related welfare issues.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Guantanamo Bay
Purpose: To bring together parliamentarians in support of the Obama administrations pledge to close Guantanamo Bay. To work with counterparts across the Atlantic and add support for future administrations to release remaining detainees and close Guantanamo Bay.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Gypsies, Travellers and Roma
Purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians concerned about issues facing Gypsies, Travellers and Roma.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Haemophilia and Contaminated Blood
Purpose: To promote awareness of, and campaign for, people with haemophilia and other bleeding disorders and people infected with Hepatitis C and HIV due to contaminated blood products used in their NHS treatment.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Hair Industry
Purpose: To promote the role of qualified, professional hairdressers and barbers and facilitate an informed debate amongst parliamentarians regarding all aspects of the industry.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hampshire and Isle of Wight
Purpose: To bring MPs of all parties together with key leaders from local government and the private sector to help maximise future investment in Hampshire and the Isle of Wight for the benefit of all its local communities and local economies; and to ensure improved governance arrangements through devolution of powers.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Health Group
Purpose: The APPG is an all-party forum dedicated to disseminating knowledge, generating debate and facilitating engagement on health issues amongst Members of both Houses of Parliament.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Health in all Policies
Purpose: Recognising that the determinants of health cannot be influenced by health policy on its own, the APPG aims to promote consideration of and explore the effects of all national public policy on the health of the populations of the UK, and particularly on health inequalities between different population groups.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Healthy Homes and Buildings
Purpose: To bring together businesses, campaign organisations and decision makers to promote the vital contribution made to the UK's health, wellbeing and economic prosperity by creating and building warm, dry, noise and energy efficient, safe, secure and accessible homes and buildings.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Heart Disease
Purpose: To help ensure everyone living with cardiovascular disease (CVD) has access to high quality, integrated health and social care services, including by establishing CVD as a political priority, informing parliamentarians about diagnosis and treatment for people living with CVD and how these can be improved, monitoring the impact of government decisions on CVD, and ensuring policies are evidence based and patient centred.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Heathrow and the Wider Economy
Purpose: To examine the implications of new runway capacity in London, in particular at Heathrow.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Heritage Rail
Purpose: To brief parliamentarians about heritage railways, the contribution they make to their local and regional economies and the skills training opportunities involved.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Highways
Purpose: To share and discuss information about the maintenance of the UK's highways, both national and local.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Hillsborough Disaster
Purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss the securing of "Justice for the 96" following the September 2012 publication of the Hillsborough independent panel report.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for British Hindus
Purpose: To support and promote the interests of British Hindus to Parliament; to encourage political parties in the UK to actively engage with the British Hindu community to ensure proper Hindu representation at all levels of politics; to consider related international issues on behalf of British Hindus; to press for more government engagement with the Hindu community; to highlight and acknowledge the exceptional and significant contribution of the British Hindu community in all walks of life.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Historic Vehicles Group
Purpose: To encourage interest in, and the promotion and use of, vintage historic and classic vehicles.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on HIV and AIDS
Purpose: To facilitate good policy making, respectful of human rights, that will limit the spread of HIV, mitigate its impact and support those already living with the virus, in the UK and internationally, and to hold the government to account for its relevant commitments.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Holy See
Purpose: To monitor the relationship between the UK and the Holy See and call representatives of faith communities and the foreign/diplomatic service to brief the group on issues pertaining to the Vatican and the work of the Catholic church.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Home Electrical Safety Group
Purpose: To raise parliamentary awareness of issues relating to electrical safety in domestic dwellings and to promote the prevention of accidents with electricity; to provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss issues pertinent to their constituents on electrical safety; and to hold inquiries into policy issues and provide reports.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Ending Homelessness
Purpose: To bring together parliamentarians to scrutinise and make recommendations for the work fo a wide range of departments who are key to ending homelessness.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on "Honour" Based Abuse
Purpose: To debate and scrutinise issues relating to "honour" based abuse. To raise awareness of "honour" based abuse with a view to attempting to expose and eradicate such practices in the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Horse
Purpose: To promote the welfare of horses (including all equines, horse riders and users) and matters affecting the horse industry.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hospice and Palliative Care
Purpose: To maintain and develop an interest in hospice and palliative care, and generally, in the case of those with life-limiting or life-threatening condition.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Housing and Care for Older People
Purpose: To promote discussion and set the agenda for developing better, more joined up housing care for older people, promising greater choices in later life.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Housing and Planning
Purpose: To establish a collaborative platform aimed toward securing workable solutions to Britain's national housing emergency.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Human Rights Group
Purpose: To raise the profile of international human rights issues within Parliament and to investigate and publicise human rights abuses occurring outside the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Human Trafficking and Modern Slavery
Purpose: To raise awareness of the scale and effects of human trafficking into the UK and EU; to seek solutions to reduce supply and demand and to improve welfare provisions for victims.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Humanist Group
Purpose: To bring together non religious MPs and peers to discuss matters of shared interests.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hunger
Purpose: To raise the issue of hunger in this country, to try to understand the underlying causes and ways of addressing the issue.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Inclusive Growth
Purpose: To create a parliamentary space for a high-level dialogue between MPs, peers, businesses, faith groups, trade unions and academics. The goal is to identify how to reconnect wealth creation and social justice.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Indian Traditional Sciences
Purpose: To promote and facilitate informed discussion on issues concerning all Indian traditional sciences practised in the UK (Ayurveda, Jyotish, Indian classical music, Siddha, Unani, Vastu, Yoga etc) within Parliament by providing a forum for cross-party parliamentarians, senior policy makers, academics, leading community figures and other stakeholders.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Industrial Heritage
Purpose: To promote the industrial heritage of the United Kingdom.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Infant Feeding and Inequalities
Purpose: To raise awareness of infant feeding and allow MPs, Peers and policy stakeholders an opportunity to meet regularly to ensure that this topic remains a priority for HM Government with a view to reducing inequalities and improving health.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Inflammatory Bowel Disease
Purpose: To work with Parliamentarians and stakeholders to raise awareness of Crohn's Disease, Ulcerative Colitis and other forms of Inflammatory Bowel Disease to ensure high quality, sustainable, patient-centred clinical care, drive pioneering research and reduce discrimination in accessing services across the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Infrastructure
Purpose: To highlight the importance of infrastructure, engineering and the use of underground space to the economy and society, and to hear from experts and discuss matters arising.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Insurance and Financial Services
Purpose: To examine issues of interest to the insurance and broader financial sectors, especially where there are legislative implications.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Integrated Healthcare
Purpose: To provide a forum for discussion on issues related to integrated healthcare; to stimulate well-informed debate among politicians and stakeholders; and to contribute towards the development of knowledge and policies on the subject.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Intellectual Property
Purpose: To debate and highlight the value of intellectual property (IP) and the importance of its promotion and protection.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Intelligent Energy
Purpose: To develop among parliamentarians and key opinion formers a deeper understanding of energy efficiency technologies and processes through parliamentary activity, public information and broad political debate.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Interfaith Group
Purpose: To help parliamentarians be aware of the religious dimensions to current issues.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on International Mining
Purpose: To facilitate greater unbiased debate on the role of UK international mining companies, their role in the social and environmental development of host nations, and the role of the UK within the sector.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on International Students
Purpose: To recognise the internationalisation and global prominence of UK education; promote the value of international students to UK education, economy and 'soft power'; raise awareness of issues which affect international students and UK education; and provide a platform for collaboration between parliamentarians, international education institutions and professionals and business leaders.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for International Trade and Investment
Purpose: To discuss ways in which the UK government can help UK businesses export and take part in international trade and promote links between parliamentarians, industry and government.

Title: Parliamentary Internet, Communications and Technology Forum (an All-Party Parliamentary Group)
Purpose: To further the understanding of policy issues affecting the internet, communications and technology sector between parliamentarians, the industry, consumer groups and academia.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Islamic Finance
Purpose: To give the Islamic finance industry a voice in Parliament; to address issues as they arise such as Sukuk issuances, inclusivity, regulation and taxation whilst positioning the UK as the European hub of Islamic financial services, and also to play a wider role in promoting ethical finance.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Islamophobia
Purpose: To combat Islamophobia by investigating the forms, manifestations and extent of prejudice, discrimination and hatred against Muslims in the UK, while reviewing legislation and policy, the recording and prosecution of hate crimes, the role of the media, and the use of social media platforms as a means for spreading hatred.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary ITV Group
Purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to consider and discuss the role and contribution of ITV in broadcasting in the UK and regulatory issues.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Jainism
Purpose: To raise the profile of Jainism in the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Jazz Appreciation Group
Purpose: To promote and appreciation of jazz music and to engage Parliament in an awareness of the issues facing jazz music, musicians and promoters.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on British Jews
Purpose: To promote understanding of the aspirations and challenges of the UK 's Jewish community, with topics including religious freedoms and religious practices, faith based education, welfare and social justice; and to celebrate the culture and the achievements of the UK's Jewish Community.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Key Cities
Purpose: To promote the work of the Key Cities group to empower cities across the UK to drive economic growth and improve public services for their residents.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Kidney Group
Purpose: To improve understanding in Parliament of kidney disease and transplant medicine and promote improvements in the health and care services that are available to improve the health of people with renal failure.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Learning Disability
Purpose: To look at the issues facing people with a learning disability and their families. The group looks at the key issues of the day, across areas including health, social care, education, work and benefits.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Leasehold and Commonhold Reform
Purpose: To discuss leasehold and commonhold legislation and how the current law and systems can be improved.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Legal Aid
Purpose: To promote parliamentary and public understanding of the importance of the role of publicly funded legal services.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Legal and Constitutional Affairs
Purpose: To facilitate greater interaction between Parliament and the different branches of the legal profession, and to promote dialogue and understanding of legal and constitutional issues relating to justice and the legal services sector.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Rights
Purpose: To support and protect the rights of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) people around the world.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Libraries
Purpose: To promote the role of libraries in society and the economy, and examine themes in the wider information and knowledge sector.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Life Sciences
Purpose: To raise awareness and understanding of the valuable contribution the life sciences sector provides to the health and wealth of the nation.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Light Rail
Purpose: To encourage, promote and develop discussions relating to light rail and its many merits as a mode of transport.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Limits to Growth
Purpose: To create the space for cross-party dialogue on environmental and social limits to growth; to assess the evidence for such limits, identify the risks and build support for appropriate responses; and to contribute to the international debate on redefining prosperity and rethinking growth.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Listed Properties
Purpose: To speak up for listed properties in the UK and raise awareness in Parliament of the role played by their owners in protecting the nation's heritage; and to advocate policies that support owners in preserving listed properties,including tax and planning reform.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Literacy
Purpose: To champion the fight to improve public understanding of the vital importance and impact of literacy to ensure parliamentary knowledge and support for the latest research, policy and best practice in the field of literacy.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Liver Health
Purpose: To promote discussion of liver disease, including its major causes of viral hepatitis, alcohol and obesity, and to raise matters of concern with, and make representations to, government and other policy makers.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Local Authority Pension Funds
Purpose: To discuss the issues and concerns of local authority pension funds and the work of the Local Authority Pension Fund Forum.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Democracy
Purpose: To promote the virtues of exiting forms of first tier local authorities; to inform policy making and initiatives affecting first tier local authorities; and to stimulate debate on models of community governance.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Government
Purpose: To discuss issues of interest and concern to parliamentarians and councillors about local government.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for London
Purpose: To promote London in the interests of all its people, places and businesses as a global city and powerhouse of the economy.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the London-Stansted-Cambridge Corridor
Purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to consider and discuss how best to promote economic development and enhance quality of life in the London-Stansted-Cambridge corridor

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for London's Planning and Built Environment
Purpose: To explore the social, economic and environmental issues affecting London at a strategic level and build consensus as to the ways in which these might be addressed.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Looked After Children and Care Leavers
Purpose: To promote the voice of children and young people in care, in order to promote first class government policy for children in care.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Lyme Disease
Purpose: To raise awareness of and campaign for Lyme Disease treatment and research.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Magistracy
Purpose: To raise the profile of issues which impact on magistrates' courts; to encourage a co-ordinated approach to policies which affect the magistracy; and to work through parliamentary channels to promote the sound administration of justice.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Malaria and Neglected Tropical Diseases
Purpose: To raise awareness of malaria and neglected tropical diseases amongst parliamentarians; and to encourage Government to provide political will, leadership and sustainable funding for the necessary prevention and treatment.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Management
Purpose: To promote and foster closer understanding between parliamentarians and UK managers from across all sectors.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Manufacturing Group
Purpose: To encourage the exchange of knowledge and understanding between Parliament and the manufacturing industries, helping to raise the profile of manufacturing both inside and outside of Parliament.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Marine Energy and Tidal Lagoons
Purpose: To promote the economic, supply chain and energy security benefits from the development of marine energy resources in and around the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Maritime and Ports
Purpose: To provide a forum for the exchange of views between parliamentarians and leading figures in the shipping and ports industries.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Markets Group
Purpose: To ensure the viability and stress the economic importance of the UK's retail markets industry.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Maternity
Purpose: To improve the quality of maternity services, raise awareness of the contribution maternity care can make to public health, and improve support during the first 1000 days of parenthood.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Mayflower Pilgrims
Purpose: To promote the historic roots of the Mayflower Pilgrims in the United Kingdom in the lead up to the 400th anniversary of their arrival in the United States.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Media Group
Purpose: To provide a forum for Members to discuss public policy on regulation of the media.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Medical Research
Purpose: To provide an ongoing forum and network for parliamentarians with an interest in medical research; to facilitate collaboration between parliamentarians and medical research bodies; to provide MPs and peers with up to date information on developments in medical research, including aspects of public health, ethics of research, and the implications of research findings for society.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Non Profit Making Members' Clubs
Purpose: To support non profit making members clubs across the United Kingdom.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Meningitis
Purpose: To provide a forum for MPs and Peers to work on behalf of people affected by meningitis, raising issues of concern with government and other policy makers and keeping meningitis high on the agenda.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mental Health
Purpose: To inform parliamentarians about all aspects of mental health.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mersey Dee North Wales
Purpose: To forge further economic, social and political links in the unique, urban cross-border areas of North Wales, the Wirral and Cheshire West and Chester.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Micronutrients and Health
Purpose: To promote awareness and understanding, and help form strategies in Parliament, of the vital role of micronutrients (vitamins and minerals) in helping people to be healthier, and of the importance of nutritional food supplements, which are now taken by over 25 million consumers, 60% of them on a daily basis.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Migration
Purpose: To promote and facilitate evidence based debate on migration and its impact on the UK economy and society among parliamentarians.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mindfulness
Purpose: To review research evidence, current best practice, extent and success of implementation, and potential developments in the application of mindfulness within a range of policy areas, and to develop policy recommendations for government based on these findings.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Mining and Quarrying
Purpose: To share and distribute information and updates on the UK Minerals sector, particularly the construction aggregates sector.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Modern Languages

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Motor Group

The joint-secretariat partners collaborate to support this mission.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Motor Neurone Disease
Purpose: To raise awareness in Parliament of Motor Neurone Disease (MND) and to provide a forum for discussion among parliamentarians on issues that affect MND sufferers.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Motorcycle Speedway

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Motorsport
Purpose: To promote the uptake of STEM (science, technology, engineering and math) subjects throughout the UK using all forms of motorised sport.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Mountain and Cave Rescue
Purpose: To promote the virtues of mountain rescue and to campaign for improved support and increased awareness of mountain rescue.

Title: Mountaineering All-Party Parliamentary Group
Purpose: To promote the sporting and recreational interests of climbers, hill walkers and mountaineers; to raise awareness of the physical and social benefits of mountaineering; and to campaign for sustainable access to cliffs, mountains and open countryside.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Multiple Sclerosis
Purpose: To promote the interests of people affected by MS (Multiple Sclerosis).

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Muscular Dystrophy
Purpose: Raises awareness of all types of muscular dystrophy and neuromuscular conditions and promotes links between parliament, individuals and families affected by these muscle-wasting conditions, charities, scientists, health professionals and decision-makers.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Music
Purpose: To provide a discussion forum between the music industry and parliamentarians.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Mutuals
Purpose: To discuss and support mutuals.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nuclear Energy
Purpose: A forum for Parliamentarians to discuss civil nuclear energy on a cross party basis.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nursery Schools and Nursery Classes
Purpose: To promote best practice in nursery education.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Adult and Childhood Obesity
Purpose: To act as a central resource for childhood and adult obesity related issues; to create a platform for MPs and Peers to discuss the issues around obesity; and to work with experts and stakeholders within the field.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Occupational Safety and Health

Title: British Offshore Oil and Gas All-Party Parliamentary Group

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the UK Oil Refining Sector
Purpose: To provide a forum for discussion of issues relevant to the UK oil refining sector, discuss latest developments relevant to current policy priorities, UK and EU legislation and to raise matters with government and industry itself.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Opera Group
Purpose: To provide a focal point for MPs and Peers with an interest in opera; to further the appreciation of opera; and to provide a contact point between this art form and Parliament.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Oral Hormone Pregnancy Tests
Purpose: To investigate the use of the drug 'Primodos' and other oral hormone pregnancy tests.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Osteoposis Group
Purpose: To inform both Houses about Osteoporosis.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Packaging Manufacturing Industry.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pakistan Minorities

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pancreatic Cancer

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Parents and Families

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Park Homes

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Parkinson's

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Patient Safety
Purpose: To address and continue to highlight patient safety issues in the health and care sector.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Penal Affairs

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pensions

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pharmacy

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Philately Group

The group works to ensure that the government adopts policies that will reduce the harm of these substances and help spread good evidence-based prevention throughout the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Public Legal Education
Purpose: To educate the public about the legal system; to increase understanding in Parliament of public legal education; to provide a forum for parliamentarians to work with organisations in the field to ensure a supportive policy environment that enables public legal education to flourish and to encourage initiatives which improve legal capability.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Publishing
Purpose: To promote British publishing excellence and its economic, social, educational and cultural contribution, and to facilitate better understanding among parliamentarians of the issues facing the sector.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Pubs
Purpose: To promote and campaign for the interests of pubs, landlords, and the communities around these pubs.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Race and Community
Purpose: To increase the coverage of race and equality issues in Parliament; to update members on race equality issues and up-to-date research; and to connect the group with race equality organisations.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Racing and Bloodstock Industries Group
Purpose: To promote the racing and bloodstock industries within Parliament; to inform member of both Houses about the industries; and to service the well-being of the industries.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Rail Group
Purpose: To facilitate an informed debate amongst parliamentarians regarding all aspects of the UK's railway industries.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Rail in the North Group
Purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to consider and discuss the strategic rail network in the north of England and to raise awareness of these issues in Parliament and with stakeholders.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rare, Genetic and Undiagnosed Conditions
Purpose: To increase awareness in Parliament of rare, genetic and undiagnosed conditions and help to ensure that patients and families affected by those conditions have access to appropriate care and support.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Reform, Decentralisation and Devolution in the UK
Purpose: To facilitate discussion on Reform, Decentralisation and Devolution in the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Refugees
Purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion of issues relating to refugees, both in the UK and abroad, and to promote the welfare of refugees.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Regional Airports
Purpose: To promote and highlight the interests of Regional Airports and the communities they serve. To ensure that Parliament is aware of the challenges currently faced by regional airports and the opportunities to maximise transport connectivity and the wider contribution to the UK economy.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Religion in the Media
Purpose: To foster a better understanding and representation of religion in the media as religion is a prime motivator of individuals and the community. Also, to aim for a seventh public purpose for the BBC in charter renewal, namely to promote religious literacy.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on International Freedom of Religion or Belief
Purpose: To raise awareness and profile of international freedom of belief as a human right amongst parliamentarians, media, government and the UK general public; and to increase effectiveness and awareness of the UK's contribution to international institutions charged with enforcing this human right.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Religious Education
Purpose: To provide a medium through which parliamentarians and organisations with an interest in religious education can discuss the current provision of religious education, press for continuous improvement, promote public understanding and advocate rigorous education for every young person is religious and non-religious world views.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Renewable and Sustainable Energy Group
Purpose: To promote sustainable energy issues in Parliament and the wider political community and to discuss policy barriers to the advancement of the market for sustainable energy technologies.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Reserve Forces and Cadets
Purpose: To promote interest in Britain's Reserve Forces and generate new thinking on their role and structure.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Respiratory Health
Purpose: To raise awareness of the importance of respiratory health and to promote effective policy for improving treatments and outcomes for respiratory illnesses.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Responsible Tax
Purpose: How can Parliament help to build and maintain the fair, sustainable and transparent tax system that is needed if individuals, businesses and markets are to create growth and prosperity both in the UK and internationally?

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Retail
Purpose: To take a broader look at the future of retail: how technology will affect the industry in the coming years, how government policy specifically affects the retail industry - specifically in relation to skills and young people - and how that can be used to aid social mobility.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Retail Crime
Purpose: To raise awareness of retail crime and the impact it has on retailers and shop workers.

Title: River Thames All-Party Parliamentary Group
Purpose: To unite River Thames riparian parliamentarians to improve, protect, promote and enhance flood risk management, navigation, moorings, sport, recreation, environment, planning, tourism and education. To enhance and increase access, safety, information, employment, facilities, services, infrastructure, value and use of the entire river and its corridor environs from source to sea.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Road Passenger Transport
Purpose: To provide a forum for all stakeholders in the road passenger transport industry and Members.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Roofing Industry
Purpose: To raise awareness of the roofing industry in Parliament.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rowing
Purpose: To support the sport of rowing both within Parliament and outside.

Title: Royal Television Society All-Party Parliamentary Group
Purpose: To provide a vehicle for parliamentarians, together with members and patrons of the Royal Television Society, to debate and promote education in the air, science and technology of television and encourage high standards of creativity.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Rugby League
Purpose: To support the sport of rugby league football.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rugby Union
Purpose: To promote the sport of rugby union.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Rule of Law
Purpose: To promote parliamentary and public discussion on the rule of law as a practical concept.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Runaway and Missing Children and Adults
Purpose: The group is formed to raise awareness about the level of risk of harm to children, young people and vulnerable adults who go missing from home or care.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Running
Purpose: To encourage running as a sport nationally; to support constituency running and athletics clubs; and to help employers and businesses of all sizes to encourage running in the workplace.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Rural Business
Purpose: To champion rural business and secure policy outcomes that promote the sustainable growth of the rural economy.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rural Crime
Purpose: To bring colleagues together to look at better ways of tackling rural crime. There are many crimes that are particular to rural areas, as well as specific challenges to addressing crime in remote communities. The APPG will be looking at the issue from prevention to policing to prosecution.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rural Health and Social Care
Purpose: To develop evidence-based policy recommendations for the government on the rural health (both mental and physical) and social care economy of England. Current models are not suited to rural areas with sparse populations and a disproportionate number of over 85s with comorbidities including isolation and other mental health problems.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rural Services
Purpose: To promote debate on the provision of rural services and to issue periodic reports.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on School Food
Purpose: To provide a parliamentary forum for the discussion of all matters relating to food education in schools and other settings; to push the issue of food in schools up the political agenda on a cross-party basis; and to provide a forum through which external organisations concerned in matters related to school food, child hunger and food education can share best practice and establish shared positions and priorities.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Science and Technology in Agriculture
Purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians and stakeholders to debate and highlight the value of science and technology in agriculture.

Title: Parliamentary and Scientific Committee (an All-Party Parliamentary Group)
Purpose: To be a primary focus for scientific and technological issues, providing a long-term liaison between parliamentarians and scientific bodies, science-based industry and the academic world.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Scotch Whisky
Purpose: To promote and facilitate communication and understanding between representatives from the Scotch Whisky industry and MPs.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Scottish Sport
Purpose: To discuss and advance issues of importance to Scottish sport by complementing the work of the Scottish government and all Scottish governing bodies.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Self-Build, Custom and Community Housebuilding and Placemaking
Purpose: To promote awareness and availability of self-build housing and customer-led commissioning of housing by individuals and by groups, both for private purchase and for affordable rental – e.g. through housing co-operatives and housing associations – particularly by advocating provision of serviced plots of land; and to promote debate on placemaking.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Self-Employment and Freelancing
Purpose: To raise awareness of self-employment and the freelance way of working, act as a bridge between freelancers, the self-employed and politicians; to support and promote freelancers and the self-employed and their contribution to the UK economy, and draw attention to the challenges they face.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sepsis
Purpose: To provide a medium through which Parliamentarians, organisations and those affected by Sepsis can discuss the current provision for the illness, which claims 44,000 lives in the UK every year, promote public understanding and advocate for simple, timely interventions to be implemented as standard across the NHS.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sex Equality
Purpose: To campaign for the advancement of sex equality in the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sexual and Reproductive Health in the UK
Purpose: To raise awareness in Parliament of the importance of improving all aspects of the sexual health of women and men in the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Prevention of Sexual Violence in Conflict
Purpose: To follow up on the ad hoc Select Committee report on the prevention of sexual violence in conflict and to promote the campaign the report recommends.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Shale Gas Regulation and Planning
Purpose: To recommend an effective regulation and planning regime should shale gas extraction take place.

Title: All-Party Parliamentry Group on Ship Building
Purpose: The group is concerned with ship repair and the ship building industry in the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Shooting and Conservation
Purpose: To discuss and promote the interests and issues regarding shooting and conservation.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sickle Cell and Thalassemia
Purpose: To further the understanding of, and enhance treatment for, patients with Sickle Cell and Thalassemia

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for British Sikhs
Purpose: To support and promote the interests of Sikhs in Britain; to work with British Sikhs to celebrate Sikh culture in the UK; and to ensure full equality for all British Sikhs.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Sixth Form Colleges
Purpose: To promote and support the interests of designated sixth form colleges and to advise Government on the challenges facing the sector.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Skills and Employment
Purpose: The APPG is a coalition of UK parliamentarians from all parties, devoted to raising the profile of skills and employment policy in the UK. The APPG brings together Parliament, employers, and the skills sector to promote and develop effective skills policy as a central means of personal and economic development for the 21st century.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Skin
Purpose: To raise awareness of skin conditions in Parliament, improve treatment for patients with skin disease, improve efficiency in service commissioning and increase the number of dermatologists within the NHS.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Small and Micro Business
Purpose: To raise awareness of small and micro business issues within parliament.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Small Shops Group
Purpose: To raise awareness of the positive economic and social contribution of small shops and the areas of public policy that affect them.

Title: Smart Cities All-Party Parliamentary Group
Purpose: To engage parliamentarians who share an interest in how the digital revolution can benefit our cities and how the UK can take the lead in seizing a substantial share of the international 'smart cities' market.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Smoking and Health
Purpose: To monitor and discuss the health and social effects of smoking; to review potential change to existing legislation to reduce smoking prevalence; to assess the latest medical techniques to assist smoking cessation; and to act as a resource for members on all issues relating to smoking and public health.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Social Enterprise
Purpose: To raise awareness of social enterprise amongst parliamentarians, showcase social enterprises, and discuss issues important to the movement.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Social Integration
Purpose: To drive forward a cross-party conversation on policy solutions to break down barriers to integration and create opportunities for people from all walks of life to build bonds of trust.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Social Mobility
Purpose: To discuss and evaluate key issues and indicators of social mobility and barriers to it. To hold seminars and meetings to present and highlight the latest research on social mobility.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Social Work
Purpose: To promote knowledge and understanding of social work.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Soft Drinks
Purpose: To promote the contribution of the soft drinks industry to the UK and consider issues that affect the industry. The group will aim to raise awareness of these contributions and issues in Parliament.

Title: All-Party Parliametnary South West Rail Group
Purpose: To support and promote improvement to rail infrastructure and services in the South West.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Southern Rail
Purpose: To scrutinise the operation and performance of the Southern Rail franchise with a view to ensuring service improvement by the franchise. We will act for the best interests of passengers by providing challenge to all organisations, including the government, which have a bearing on operational performance.

Title: Parliamentary Space Committee (An All-Party Parliamentary Group)
Purpose: To raise awareness in Parliament of the importance and opportunities of space based capabilities to the UK economy, policy making, society and the space community; to highlight and promote the benefits from the UK's investment in space and its leading role within the global space economy.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Speech and Language Difficulties
Purpose: To make Parliament aware that the ability to communicate is a crucial life skill for all; to increase awareness about the impact communication difficulties have on other people's lives; to highlight the importance of early identification and intervention; and to press for increased provision of speech and language therapy.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Spinal Cord Injury
Purpose: To look at specific issues being faced by spinal cord injury (SCI) people, particularly relating to medical treatment, care, support and developments in treatments, as well as social care and wider issues that affect the lives of SCI people.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Sport
Purpose: To be the central, constructive, cross-party voice for sport in Parliament.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Squash and Racketball
Purpose: To support and raise the profile of the sports squash and racketball in parliament.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Srebrenica
Purpose: To increase awareness of the Srebrenica genocide and institutionalise 11 July in the UK as Srebrenica Memorial Day in line with the 2009 resolution of the European Parliament as the best means of honouring the victims, sending a clear message to future generations and stressing the importance of reconciliation as part of the European integration process.

Title: St George's Day All-Party Parliamentary Group
Purpose: To promote 23 April as an annual celebration of England and the country's patron saint, St George, and to campaign for St George's Day to be established as a public holiday for the people of England.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on State Pension Inequality for Women
Purpose: To provide a cross-party forum in which to hold the government to account on the issue of transitional arrangements to compensate 1950s-born women who are affected by changes to the state pension age and to campaign on issues around the state pension age.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Statistics
Purpose: To serve as a parliamentary forum for the discussion of statistical issues, including the work of the UK statistics authority, the use of statistics by parliamentarians, and pre-release access to official statistics.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Steel and Metal Related Industries
Purpose: To ensure a fair deal for the UK steel and metal related industries by liaising with and lobbying the government, to raise the profile of cultural, environmental and social issues in the industry and its communities, and to research and develop policies which will promote thriving steel and cast metal industries in the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Stem Cell Transplantation
Purpose: To inform parliamentarians about the use of stem cell transplantation in saving lives; to facilitate debate and scrutiny on the collection and use of adult stem cells and umbilical cord blood in the UK; and to promote the expansion of stem cell donation in the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Street Children
Purpose: To work to protect and promote the rights of children worldwide and to raise the various issues they fact, particularly street children. This work includes receiving reports of human rights violations against children globally and communicating concerns to parliamentarians, ambassadors and governments.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Students
Purpose: To provide a forum for all parliamentarians to develop greater understanding of the range of issues affecting students in further and higher education. The group aims to ensure that student views and experiences are heard in Parliament and facilitate interaction between students and MPs and Peers.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Suicide and Self-Harm Prevention
Purpose: To raise awareness within Parliament and encourage discussion and debate of all issues involved in suicide and self-harm prevention.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Sustainable Resource Group
Purpose: To develop a deeper understanding between government, parliament and the sustainable resource management sector of the sustainable management of waste.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Tamils
Purpose: To promote in Parliament peace with justice and dignity for Tamils in the Island of Sri Lanka and advance their development so as to recognise their legitimate socio-political aspirations.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Taxation Group
Purpose: To look at and understand tax policy and taxation on all levels including simplification and digitalisation, EU Brexit and its impact on the UK’s taxation system, and international taxation. To work in partnership with HM Treasury to create a 'safe space' for Parliamentarians and interested stakeholders to meet, discuss and develop innovative proposals to reform, simplify and make the UK’s taxation system fairer.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Taxis
Purpose: To support and promote the interests of the taxi trade in parliament.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Tennis
Purpose: To promote the sport of tennis, and for MPs and peers to be able to play tennis matches together and compete with various outside tennis teams.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Thalidomide
Purpose: To provide support to those whose lives were affected by exposure to the drug Thalidomide.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Thrombosis Group
Purpose: To promote awareness amongst parliamentarians about the risk and management of venous thromboembolism (VTE); to increase knowledge of its causes, effects, treatments; and to monitor the implementation of government initiatives and other research being undertaken.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Ticket Abuse
Purpose: To promote and provide a forum for the discussion of issues relating to the sale and resale of tickets for events, with a particular focus on devising solutions to the problem of ticket touting.

Title: Tidy Britain All-Party Parliamentary Group
Purpose: To discuss issues related to local environmental quality; to raise these issues on the parliamentary agenda and to provide a forum for an exchange of views between parliamentarians and those with local environmental quality issues.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Timber Industries
Purpose: To help grow the use of timber and develop vibrant timber based industries across the whole supply chain in the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Tourism and Hospitality Industry in Wales
Purpose: To promote, inform and build understanding amongst parliamentarians of the issues that affect tourism and the tourism industry in Wales.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Tourism, Leisure and the Hospitality Industry
Purpose: To advance the benefits of tourism to the UK economy.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Town Centres
Purpose: To promote parliamentary and public understanding of the importance of the role of town and city centres and their management as a key mechanism for co-ordinated action, fostering public and private sector dialogue and co-operation in order to build environments that are healthy, sustainable and socially inclusive.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Trade out of Poverty
Purpose: To identify obstacles which prevent poor countries from entering into international trade and to encourage rich countries to open their markets to exports from the low income countries.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Transatlantic Trade
Purpose: To provide a focus for UK parliamentary cross-party support for a comprehensive transatlantic trade and investment agreement; to contribute to greater public debate and understanding of potential benefits and drawbacks for British consumers, workers, businesses; to strengthen parliamentary and public scrutiny to help secure a successful agreement.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Transport Safety
Purpose: To protect human life through the promotion of transport safety for the public benefit.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Tuberculosis
Purpose: To accelerate the progress towards ending the TB epidemic

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on UK and Europe
Purpose: To provide a forum for UK parliamentary cross-party discussion on the UK's relationship with the European Union; to contribute to the debate around key issues in the UK-EU negotiations; and to strengthen parliamentary and public support for a continuing close relationship with Europe.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on UK-EU Relations
Purpose: To promote a positive and progressive relationship between the United Kingdom and the European Union following the outcome of the EU Referendum.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Unconventional Oil and Gas
Purpose: To provide a forum for transparent, evidence based discussion around the issue of unconventional oil and gas development in the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Union
Purpose: To discuss how best to preserve and maintain the Union of Great Britain and Northern Ireland in the face of the many challenges and opportunities in the early 21st century; and to put in place an overall strategy which can accommodate the four constituent parts of the United Kingdom.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the United Nations
Purpose: To support the aims and ideals of the United Nations. Our objective is to raise awareness among parliamentarians about the UN, including its contributions to peace and security, development and human rights; international law; and the relevance of the organisation to the British electorate.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the United Nations Global Goals for Sustainable Development
Purpose: To promote the United Nations Global Goals for Sustainable Development and monitor their implementation.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Universities
Purpose: To be the main avenue of communication between parliamentarians and vice-chancellors of the UK's universities; and to provide an opportunity to examine issues affecting the country's university sector and university research which is influencing public policy and higher level skills.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Vaccinations for All
Purpose: To raise the political profile of the importance of routine vaccinations both around the world and within the UK; and to encourage Government to provide leadership and sustainable funding on confronting the challenges of ensuring equitable access to vaccines to everyone, no matter where they live.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Vascular Disease
Purpose: Raising awareness of vascular disease and encouraging actions to promote its prevention and treatment; encouraging research into the causes of vascular disease; advancing excellence and innovation in vascular health, and informing parliamentarians of the work of medical professionals, and how they can be helped to provide better services.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Vegetarianism and Veganism
Purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians, academics, organisations and interested individuals to meet to promote and raise awareness of vegetarianism and veganism and to discuss issues relating to vegetarian and vegan lifestyles.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Veterans Group
Purpose: To maintain a strong focus from government and policy makers on the importance of veterans, young and old, to our communities and way of life and to work with the relevant service organisations to build a strong profile to enhance our work supporting veterans.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Video Games
Purpose: To work with the video games industry, including with its trade bodies TIGA and UKIE, to promote within parliament the work and economic contribution of the industry.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Visitor Economy
Purpose: Enhancing our local economy by promoting measures and incentives, including a reduction of VAT on tourism, which would increase visitor numbers and investment in all parts of Britain and Northern Ireland.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on War Heritage
Purpose: To promote and support the protection, conservation and interpretation of war graves, war memorials and battlefield sites.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Water Group
Purpose: To provide a focus for members to monitor government and regulatory policy and maintain a dialogue with consumers and those with an interest or a duty in relation to the environment and the water industry.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Water and Sanitation in the Third World
Purpose: To monitor issues regarding water and sanitation in the third world

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Water Safety and Drowning Prevention
Purpose: To raise awareness of the issue of death by drowning in the UK and to provide a forum for discussion on water safety related issues.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Waterways

Title: Protect our Waves All-Party Parliamentary Group
Purpose: To address the impacts of sewer overflows and untreated human sewage discharges at UK Coastal beaches, tackle marine litter on our coastlines and prevent inappropriate coastal developments on surfing resources, bathing waters and beaches in our region and around the UK.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Wellbeing Economics
Purpose: The groups exists to: provide a forum of discussion of wellbeing issues and public policy in Parliament; provide enhancement of wellbeing as an important government goal; encourage the adoption of wellbeing indicators as complementary measures of progress to GDP; promote policies designed to enhance wellbeing.

Title: West Coast Main Line All-Party Parliamentary Group
Purpose: To work in consultation with the West Coast Rail 250 Campaign for the upgrading and continued renewal of the infrastructure and rolling stock on the West Coast Main Line.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the West Midlands
Purpose: To bring together MPs and Peers, from across the West Midlands region and from all parties, together with key leaders – the mayor and those in local government, the private sector and social enterprise – to help maximise future investment in the region for the benefit of all its local communities.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the White Ribbon Campaign UK
Purpose: To engage parliamentarians (particularly male parliamentarians) in raising awareness and challenging male violence against women and girls in all forms.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Wine and Spirit Group
Purpose: To promote and inform on the economic and commercial benefits of the UK wine and spirit trade; to inform and stimulate debate on issues of relevance to the trade and to consumers; and to introduce parliamentarians to members of the trade from their constituencies.

Title: Women and Enterprise All-Party Parliamentary Group
Purpose: The group works to ensure the challenges and opportunities for women entrepreneurs are considered and promoted cross-party and across both Houses.

Title: Women and Work All-Party Parliamentary Group
Purpose: To promote discussion around women and work.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Women in Parliament

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Women in the Penal System
Purpose: To increase knowledge and awareness of issues around women in the penal system as well as push for the full implementation of the Corston Report recommendations.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Women in Transport
Purpose: To provide a forum to discuss and overcome the under-representation of women in transport by promoting best practice examples of employers leading the way in gender diversifying their workforce.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women, Peace and Security
Purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion and analysis of issues relating to women, peace and security, bringing together civil society, policymakers and parliamentarians. Focused on UK implementation of Security Council Resolution 1325, the APPG promotes the vital role women play in peacebuilding, conflict resolution and post-conflict reconstruction globally.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women's Health
Purpose: To empower women to ensure that they can make an informed choice about the best treatment for them and that they are treated with dignity and respect.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Women's Sport and Fitness
Purpose: To promote all aspects of women's sport and fitness; to raise the profile of women's sport and to promote better coverage of women's sport in the media; and to investigate ways to increase participation of girls and women in sport and reduce barriers to participation.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Wood Panel Industry
Purpose: To raise within Parliament issues of concern to the wood panel industry and provide parliamentarians with accurate information about matters relating to the wood panel industry.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Writers Group
Purpose: To represent the interests of all writers; to safeguard their intellectual property rights; and to ensure they receive a fair level of recognition and reward for their contribution to the economy and society as a whole.

Title: Yorkshire and Northern Lincolnshire All-Party Parliamentary Group
Purpose: To bring MPs of all parties together with key leaders - those in local government, the private sector and social enterprise - to help maximise future investment in the regions for the benefit of all its local communities and local economies.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Young Disabled People
Purpose: To work within Parliament for the interests of young disabled people with mobility difficulties, in particular to fight against the social injustices experienced by these young people.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Young People and Social Technology
Purpose: To raise awareness of the risks and opportunities posed by technology to children and young people.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Youth Affairs
Purpose: To raise the profile of issues which affect and concern young people; to encourage dialogue between parliamentarians, young people and youth services; and to encourage a co-ordinated and coherent approach to policy making on youth affairs.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Youth Employment
Purpose: To promote youth employment in all its forms, the role of young people within the economy and their voices. To highlight the need for quality opportunities and share best practice.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Youth Hostelling
Purpose: To promote and advance the benefits of youth hostelling in England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Zoos and Aquariums Group
Purpose: To promote conservation through education and understanding.

Title: Zoroastrian All-Party Parliamentary Group
Purpose: To promote interest in the Zoroastrian Faith both inside and outside parliament, as well as improving links with fellow Zoroastrian parliamentarians from around the world.

Title: The All-Party Parliamentary Football Club Group
Purpose: To play football and raise money for charity.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hockey
Purpose: To promote and play Hockey.

Title: All-Party Parliamentary Commons and Lords Rugby Union Football Club Group
